bibl.title: [Letter] 1828 Sept. 29, Columbia, Tennessee [to] John Overton / T. H.Cahal :
bibl.author: Cahal, T. H.
bibl.note: This document is a letter to John Overton from T. H. Cahal regarding a tract of land registered to a Mr. Bradshaw.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
Upon reexamination, I find that Bradshaw has a deed, registered in this county, to the five hundred acres of land on Obion a part of McLean's 2500 acre tracts. It was deeded to B. Bradshaw by John McGimsey of
N North . Carolina in the year 1818 and registered the same year â€”
The health of this county is excellent, & the crops are fine. I have heard several farmers say that some of their hands picked out 100 lbs of cotton daily.
I hope your health ere now is perfectly restored
